articles.title: Tottenham sack head coach Postecoglou
articles.description: Ange Postecoglou has been sacked by Tottenham despite leading the club to Europa League glory.
articles.content:
Ange Postecoglou has been sacked by Tottenham despite leading the club to Europa League glory.
Postecoglou delivered on his promise of "always" winning in his second season thanks to the 1-0 victory over Manchester United in Bilbao on 21 May.

articles.title: Bargain Hunt expert Oghenochuko Ojiri jailed after failing to report sale of artworks to 'Hezbollah financier'
articles.description: A court heard the 53-year-old, who also appeared on the BBC's Antiques Road Trip, sold around £140,000 worth of art to a suspected Hezbollah financier.
articles.content:
An expert on TV show Bargain Hunt has been jailed for two and a half years after failing to report the sale of artworks to Lebanese businessman Nazem Ahmad.

articles.title: Pakistan rejects Modi’s ‘baseless, misleading remarks’ on first visit to held Kashmir after Pahalgam attack
articles.description: FO says Indian claims of development in IOJK undermined by military presence, freedom suppression, and arbitrary arrests, in violation of international law.
articles.content:
The Foreign Office on Friday firmly rejected the “baseless and misleading remarks” made by Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his first visit to the Indian-held Kashmir after the Pahalgam attack.

articles.title: NDRRMC raises blue alert as LPA threatens Eastern Visayas
articles.description: The National Disaster Risk Reduction Management Council (NDRRMC) has raised the Operations Center (NDRRMOC) alert status to blue at 3 p.m. in response to a low-pressure area (LPA) near Guiuan, Eastern Visayas.

articles.title: Tool to identify poisonous books developed by University of St Andrews
articles.description: Arsenic was historically mixed with copper to create a vivid green for book covers, which can irritate modern day readers
articles.content:
A new tool to quickly identify books that are poisonous to humans has been developed by the University of St Andrews.
Historically, publishers used arsenic mixed with copper to achieve a vivid emerald green colour for book covers. While the risk to t... [3441 chars]
